description: Borrowed from Middle French centre, from Latin centrum, from Ancient Greek κέντρον (kéntron), from κεντεῖν (kenteîn, “to prick, goad”).

entries.meaning: (British spelling, Canadian spelling, Ireland, South Africa, Australia, New Zealand) Alternative spelling of center.

verbs.description: centre (third-person singular simple present centres, present participle centring or centreing, simple past and past participle centred)

entries.meaning: (British spelling, Canadian spelling, Irish, South African, Australian and New Zealand) Alternative spelling of center
